name: Van Zyl's golden mole
description: Van Zyl's golden mole is a golden mole endemic to the Western Cape Province, South Africa. It is listed as an endangered species due to habitat loss. Golden moles are an ancient group of mammals who live mostly below ground. They have shiny coats of dense fur and a streamlined, formless appearance. They have no visible eyes or ears; in fact, they are blind â€“ the small eyes are covered with hairy skin. The ears are small and are hidden in the animal's fur.
